raw_comment:
What do you notice?
I notice that the non-clean energy supplies is generally dropping in the United States. The power in China and India seems to haves similar trends.
What do you wonder?
In what ways does this graph correlate to the passing of economic laws such as solar or wind tax credits.
How does this relate to you and your community?
It helps to inform me and my community how the power we use is from and if this power is sustainable for future generations. 
Create a catchy headline that captures the graphâ€™s main idea
World Super-Powers in more ways then one, How China and United States get there energy.
ace_sentences: The supply of non-clean energy in the United States is generally dropping.
The power generation in China seems to have a similar trend.
The power generation in India seems to have a similar trend.
I wonder how this graph correlates with the passing of economic laws.
Solar tax credits are economic laws.
Wind tax credits are economic laws.
This graph helps to inform me.
This graph helps to inform my community.
This graph informs us about the source of the power that we use.
This graph informs us whether this power is sustainable for future generations.
The headline is: World super-powers in more ways than one: How China and the United States get their energy.
